item.title: [PI]How do I make an specific area PvP?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:27, topic:406410”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=503411.msg3683645#msg3683645 date=1311709670]
Drawn.

The RED is the highest X and the highest Y, the BLUE is the lowest X and the Lowest Y

This is how the code is done,

	public boolean booleanName() {
		if(absX > LOWESTX && absX < HIGHESTX && absY > LOWESTY && absY < HIGHESTY) {	
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

[/quote][/quote]

If you looked at the operators, you would realize what I have been saying you retarded fuck.

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Drawn.

The RED is the highest X and the highest Y, the BLUE is the lowest X and the Lowest Y

This is how the code is done,

	public boolean booleanName() {
		if(absX > LOWESTX && absX < HIGHESTX && absY > LOWESTY && absY < HIGHESTY) {	
			return true;

item.title: [PI]How do I make an specific area PvP?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:18, topic:406410”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=503411.msg3682853#msg3682853 date=1311642478]
You guys are terrible at noticing anything.

Your symbols are backwards.

This here states that if you are ABOVE 2801 on the X axis AND below 2767 (impossible), and the same for Y axis, you will be in the pvp zone. As previously stated, it is impossible to be ‘inside’ that zone. Fix it yourself.

P.S. Javascript is not java. Learn the difference. (If you look at what his ‘Code’ syntax highlighter is, you will see what I mean)
[/quote]
What are you talking about?

That is right. (Not about the java script thing), That’s how it’s done on PI, he’s right.[/quote]

You guys are so fucking stupid.

The code RIGHT THERE says, “(absX IS GREATER THAN 2801 && (AND) absx IS LESS THAN 2767”. It also says the same, with different values for the Y axis.
If you have an IQ greater than 70, you will realize that it is impossible to be ‘in’ that area.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How do I make an specific area PvP?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:16, topic:406410”]You guys are terrible at noticing anything.

Your symbols are backwards.

This here states that if you are ABOVE 2801 on the X axis AND below 2767 (impossible), and the same for Y axis, you will be in the pvp zone. As previously stated, it is impossible to be ‘inside’ that zone. Fix it yourself.

P.S. Javascript is not java. Learn the difference. (If you look at what his ‘Code’ syntax highlighter is, you will see what I mean)[/quote]
What are you talking about?

That is right. (Not about the java script thing), That’s how it’s done on PI, he’s right.

item.title: [PI]How do I make an specific area PvP?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

You guys are terrible at noticing anything.

Your symbols are backwards.

This here states that if you are ABOVE 2801 on the X axis AND below 2767 (impossible), and the same for Y axis, you will be in the pvp zone. As previously stated, it is impossible to be ‘inside’ that zone. Fix it yourself.

P.S. Javascript is not java. Learn the difference. (If you look at what his ‘Code’ syntax highlighter is, you will see what I mean)

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]How do I make an specific area PvP?[PI]

Um no you didn’t.

@OP;
for your equipment method,

		for (int j = 0; j < c.playerEquipment.length; j++) {
			if (c.playerEquipment[j] > 0) {
				c.sendMessage("You can't take items into the waiting room!");
				return;
			}
		}

case 2465: if (PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() > 16 && c.objectX == 3091 && c.objectY == 3487) { c.sendMessage("The Waiting Room is currently too full, please try again later!"); return; } if(c.objectX == 3091 && c.objectY == 3487) { c.getPA().movePlayer(2228, 4958, 0); c.sendMessage("Welcome to the Waiting Room of Dead vs Undead, please choose your team!"); return; } if (PlayerEquipment() > 1 && c.objectX == 3091 && c.objectY == 3487) { c.sendMessage("You can't take items into the waiting room!"); return; } break;

The last if statement, what’s the correct PlayerEquipment thing?

Use this.

public boolean inWild() { if(isInFala() || isInArd() || inFunPk() || inDVU()) { return true; } if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 || absX > 3343 && absX < 3384 && absY > 9619 && absY < 9660 || absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366){ return true; } return false; }
Ha! beat you to it Extreme :d

item.title: [PI]How do I make an specific area PvP?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

[code=javascript] if(inWild() && !isInPbox() && !isInArd() && !isInFala() && !inFunPk()) {
int modY = absY > 6400 ? absY - 6400 : absY;
wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 1);
EarningPotential.checkPotential(this);
getPA().walkableInterface(197);
if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
if(inMulti()) {
getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: “+wildLevel, 199);
} else {
getPA().sendFrame126(”@yel@Level: “+wildLevel, 199);
}
} else {
getPA().multiWay(-1);
getPA().sendFrame126(”@yel@Level: “+wildLevel, 199);
}
getPA().showOption(3, 0, “Attack”, 1);
} else if (!inWild() && safeTimer > 0){
getPA().walkableInterface(197);
wildLevel = (60);
getPA().showOption(3, 0, “Attack”, 1);
getPA().sendFrame126(”@or1@"+safeTimer, 199);
} else if(inPcBoat()) {
getPA().walkableInterface(21005);
} else if(inPcGame()) {
getPA().walkableInterface(21100);
} else if (inDuelArena()) {
getPA().walkableInterface(201);
if(duelStatus == 5) {
getPA().showOption(3, 0, “Attack”, 1);
} else {
getPA().showOption(3, 0, “Challenge”, 1);
}
} else if (inFunPk()) {
getPA().walkableInterface(197);
getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@FunPk", 199);
getPA().showOption(3, 0, “Attack”, 1);
} else if(inBarrows()){
getPA().sendFrame99(2);
getPA().sendFrame126("Kill Count: "+barrowsKillCount, 4536);
getPA().walkableInterface(4535);

	} else if(inGWD()){
	        getPA().GWKC();

	} else if (inDVU()) {
                    getPA().walkableInterface(197);
                    getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@DVU", 199);
                    getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);


	} else if(safeZone()){
		getPA().walkableInterface(197);
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
		if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
			if(inMulti()) {
				getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@SafeZone", 199);
			} else {
				getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@SafeZone", 199);
			}
		} else {
			getPA().multiWay(-1);
				getPA().sendFrame126("@gre@SafeZone", 199);
					}
	

	} else if(isInFala()){
		int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
		wildLevel = 12;
		getPA().walkableInterface(197);
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
		if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
			if(inMulti()) {
			HighAndLow();
				} else {
				HighAndLow();
			}
			}
	} else if(isInPbox()){
		int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
		wildLevel = 12;
		getPA().walkableInterface(197);
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
		if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
			if(inMulti()) {
			HighAndLow();
				} else {
				HighAndLow();
			}
			}
	} else if(isInArd()){
		int modY = absY > 6400 ?  absY - 6400 : absY;
		wildLevel = 12;
		getPA().walkableInterface(197);
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
		if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
			if(inMulti()) {
			HighAndLow();
				} else {
				HighAndLow();
			}
		} else {
			getPA().multiWay(-1);
		HighAndLow();}
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);
	} else if (inCwGame || inPits) {
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Attack", 1);		
	} else if (getPA().inPitsWait()) {
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Null", 1);
	}else if (!inCwWait) {
		getPA().sendFrame99(0);
		getPA().walkableInterface(-1);
		getPA().showOption(3, 0, "Null", 1);
	}[/code]

That’s my inWild command in client class.

I’ve added the inDVU thing. However, still get the message that their not in the wilderness:/.

item.title: [PI]How do I make an specific area PvP?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“AnonymousZ, post:5, topic:406410”]It probably is my Co-ordinates, I’ve never actually done this before…as you can tell.

public boolean inDVU() { if (absX > 2801 && absX < 2767 && absY > 9502 && absY < 9480) { return true; } return false; }

Can you help me on how to set the Co-ordinates. I’m guessing the ones I have are wrong.[/quote]
I’ve always hated coords, so this is something i’ve saved on my computer from the inJail method. There are tutorials out there, but cba to find you one.
absX1 > 2801 && absX2 < 2767 && absY1 > 9502 && absY2 < 9480

absX1 is 1st
absY2 is 2nd

North left is 2nd
South right is 1st

I could be wrong.

Read full topic
